fields.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.summary: To Kill a Mockingbird is both a young girl’s coming-of-age story and a darker drama about the roots and consequences of racism and prejudice, probing how good and evil can coexist within a single community or individual.

fields.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
fields.author: Oscar Wilde
fields.summary: The Picture of Dorian Gray is a novel by Oscar Wilde that tells the story of a young man named Dorian Gray who becomes obsessed with his own beauty and begins to lead a life of pleasure-seeking and debauchery.

fields.title: Beloved
fields.author: Toni Morrison
fields.summary: Beloved is a novel by Toni Morrison that tells the story of Sethe, a former slave who escapes to freedom, but is haunted by the memory of her past and the ghost of her dead daughter.

fields.title: The Road
fields.author: Cormac McCarthy
fields.summary: The Road is a novel by Cormac McCarthy that tells the story of a father and son who journey across a post-apocalyptic wasteland in search of food, shelter, and safety.

fields.title: The Color Purple
fields.author: Alice Walker
fields.summary: The Color Purple is a novel by Alice Walker that tells the story of Celie, a young African-American woman who struggles to find her place in the world and overcome the abuse she has suffered at the hands of men.

fields.title: The Catch-22
fields.author: Joseph Heller
fields.summary: The Catch-22 is a novel by Joseph Heller that tells the story of Captain John Yossarian, a US Army Air Forces B-25 bombardier who is stationed on the Mediterranean island of Pianosa during World War II.

fields.title: Alexander Hamilton
fields.author: Ron Chernow
fields.summary: Alexander Hamilton was an illegitimate, largely self-taught orphan from the Caribbean who overcame all the odds to become George Washington’s aide-de-camp and the first Treasury Secretary of the United States. Few figures in American history are more controversial or more misunderstood.

fields.title: Little Women
fields.author: Louisa May Alcott
fields.summary: Little Women follows the lives of the four March sisters—Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy—and details their passage from childhood to womanhood. It is loosely based on the lives of the author and her three sisters.

fields.title: Daisy Jones & The Six
fields.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
fields.summary: Daisy Jones & The Six is a novel that tells the story of an iconic 1970s rock band and their rise to fame, and is told through a series of interviews with band members, friends, and family.

fields.title: Maybe You Should Talk to Someone
fields.author: Lori Gottlieb
fields.summary: Maybe You Should Talk to Someone is a non-fiction book that follows the author’s experience as a therapist and a patient, and explores the universal struggles we all face, including grief, change, and the meaning of our lives.

fields.title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
fields.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
fields.summary: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo is a novel that tells the story of an aging Hollywood icon, and the seven husbands she married and buried over the course of her life. It is a tale of love, betrayal, and the price of fame.

fields.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
fields.author: Stephen Covey
fields.summary: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People is a self-help book that provides a roadmap for personal and professional growth. Covey outlines seven habits that can transform your life, from being proactive to prioritizing and seeking win-win outcomes.

fields.title: Think and Grow Rich
fields.author: Napoleon Hill
fields.summary: Think and Grow Rich is a classic self-help book that has been used by millions to achieve success in their personal and professional lives. Hill lays out 13 principles for success, including desire, faith, and persistence.

fields.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
fields.author: Dale Carnegie
fields.summary: How to Win Friends and Influence People is a timeless self-help classic that has sold millions of copies worldwide. Carnegie provides practical advice for building relationships, gaining influence, and achieving success.

fields.title: The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
fields.author: Eckhart Tolle
fields.summary: The Power of Now is a spiritual self-help book that has helped millions find inner peace and happiness. Tolle teaches readers how to live in the present moment and let go of negative thoughts and emotions.

fields.title: Man’s Search for Meaning
fields.author: Viktor E. Frankl
fields.summary: Man’s Search for Meaning is a self-help book that draws on the author’s experiences in a Nazi concentration camp. Frankl argues that finding meaning in life is the key to survival and provides a roadmap for achieving it.

fields.title: Becoming
fields.author: Michelle Obama
fields.summary: An intimate, powerful, and inspiring memoir by the former First Lady of the United States.

fields.title: Steve Jobs
fields.author: Walter Isaacson
fields.summary: Based on more than forty interviews with Jobs conducted over two years—as well as interviews with more than a hundred family members, friends, adversaries, competitors, and colleagues.

fields.title: Unbroken
fields.author: Laura Hillenbrand
fields.summary: In boyhood, Louis Zamperini was an incorrigible delinquent. As a teenager, he channeled his defiance into running, discovering a prodigious talent that had carried him to the Berlin Olympics.

fields.title: Leonardo da Vinci
fields.author: Walter Isaacson
fields.summary: Based on thousands of pages from Leonardo da Vinci’s astonishing notebooks and new discoveries about his life and work, Walter Isaacson weaves a narrative that connects his art to his science.

fields.title: Educated
fields.author: Tara Westover
fields.summary: An unforgettable memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

fields.title: Bossypants
fields.author: Tina Fey
fields.summary: Bossypants is an autobiographical comedy book written by the American comedian Tina Fey. The book topped The New York Times Best Seller list, and stayed there for five weeks upon its release. It was well-received by critics, and her performance reading the audiobook earned her a Grammy nomination.

fields.title: Greenlights
fields.author: Matthew McConaughey
fields.summary: Greenlights is a memoir by the American actor Matthew McConaughey, which chronicles his life from childhood to the present day. The book includes stories and insights from his life, as well as reflections on his values and philosophy. It was well-received by critics and became a New York Times bestseller.

fields.title: The Hobbit
fields.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
fields.summary: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the treasure within it, from the dragon Smaug.

fields.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone
fields.author: J.K. Rowling
fields.summary: Harry Potter, a young boy who discovers he is a wizard, enrolls in Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry and uncovers a sinister plot to steal a powerful stone.

fields.title: The Name of the Wind
fields.author: Patrick Rothfuss
fields.summary: The Name of the Wind follows the story of Kvothe, a young man who becomes a notorious wizard and musician, and the events that led to him becoming a legend.

fields.title: The Hunger Games
fields.author: Suzanne Collins
fields.summary: The Hunger Games is set in a dystopian future where teenagers are forced to compete in a televised fight to the death, and follows protagonist Katniss Everdeen as she fights for survival and challenges the system.

fields.title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
fields.author: Brandon Sanderson
fields.summary: Mistborn: The Final Empire is set in a world where the Lord Ruler, an immortal tyrant, has ruled for a thousand years, and follows a group of thieves who attempt to overthrow him using their magical abilities.

fields.title: The Way of Kings
fields.author: Brandon Sanderson
fields.summary: The Way of Kings is the first book in The Stormlight Archive series, and is set in a world torn by war and conflict, and follows several characters as they navigate their way through political intrigue and supernatural events.

fields.title: A Song of Ice and Fire: A Game of Thrones
fields.author: George R.R. Martin
fields.summary: In the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, a land of multiple factions vying for power and influence, the Starks of Winterfell find themselves drawn into a web of political intrigue, betrayal, and war as they struggle to survive and hold onto their honor.

fields.title: A Brief History of Time
fields.author: Stephen Hawking
fields.summary: A landmark volume in science writing by one of the great minds of our time, Stephen Hawking’s book explores such profound questions as: How did the universe begin—and what made its start possible? Does time always flow forward? Is the universe unending—or are there boundaries?

fields.title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
fields.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
fields.summary: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry offers a quick and easy-to-understand introduction to some of the most complex concepts in astrophysics. Written by Neil deGrasse Tyson, a renowned astrophysicist and science communicator, this book covers a wide range of topics, including the nature of space and time, the history of the universe, and the mysteries of black holes and dark matter. His engaging writing style and ability to explain complex ideas in a clear and concise way make this book a must-read for anyone interested in science and the mysteries of the universe.

fields.title: Energy and Civilization: A History
fields.author: Vaclav Smil
fields.summary: In this book, Vaclav Smil provides a comprehensive history of energy and its role in human civilization, from the first human use of fire to the modern era of fossil fuels. He explores the various forms of energy that humans have used throughout history, including human and animal power, wind and water power, and the use of fossil fuels. He also considers the environmental, social, and economic impacts of our energy use, and looks ahead to the future of energy and sustainability.

fields.title: The Selfish Gene
fields.author: Richard Dawkins
fields.summary: Richard Dawkins introduces the theory of the selfish gene, which explains how genes act in their own self-interest, and how this can lead to seemingly altruistic behavior in organisms. This book is a classic in the field of evolutionary biology.

fields.title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
fields.author: Bill Bryson
fields.summary: In this book, Bill Bryson takes readers on a journey through the history of science, from the Big Bang to the present day. He explores the mysteries of the universe, the history of life on Earth, and the discoveries and breakthroughs that have shaped our understanding of the world around us. With his trademark wit and humor, Bryson makes complex scientific concepts accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds.

fields.title: Cosmos
fields.author: Carl Sagan
fields.summary: In this book, Carl Sagan takes readers on a journey through the history of the universe, from the Big Bang to the present day. He covers topics such as the origin of life, the nature of consciousness, and the search for extraterrestrial intelligence. His poetic writing and enthusiasm for science make this book a classic in the field of popular science.
